intro: Astragalus satteotoichos, commonly known as the desert milkvetch, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The plant features compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces small, yellow to greenish flowers that bloom in late spring. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with deep taproots for water storage. Astragalus satteotoichos plays a role in stabilizing soils and providing forage for wildlife in its native habitat.
